output.conclusion: This course provides a comprehensive understanding of advanced wireless communication concepts, enabling students to design and analyze modern wireless systems.
output.introduction: Welcome to Advanced Wireless Communication! This course delves into the intricacies of modern wireless systems, covering advanced modulation techniques, channel coding, multiple access schemes, and emerging wireless technologies.

chapters.description: Explore advanced modulation techniques like OFDM, MIMO-OFDM, and FBMC. Analyze their performance in terms of spectral efficiency, power efficiency, and robustness to channel impairments.
Delve into the practical aspects of OFDM system design, including synchronization, channel estimation, and PAPR reduction techniques.
Understand the principles of Multiple-Input Multiple-Output (MIMO) systems. Explore spatial multiplexing, beamforming, and space-time coding techniques.
Study advanced channel coding techniques such as Turbo codes, LDPC codes, and Polar codes. Analyze their performance in terms of error correction capability and decoding complexity.
Understand the design and implementation of Turbo codes, including interleaver design and iterative decoding algorithms.
Analyze the properties of LDPC codes, including their Tanner graph representation and decoding algorithms such as belief propagation.
Explore advanced multiple access techniques such as NOMA, SCMA, and massive MIMO. Analyze their performance in terms of spectral efficiency, user fairness, and complexity.
Understand the principles of Non-Orthogonal Multiple Access (NOMA), including power allocation and successive interference cancellation (SIC).
Explore the architecture and performance of massive MIMO systems, including channel estimation and precoding techniques.
Explore emerging wireless technologies such as 5G and beyond, including millimeter wave communication, ultra-reliable low-latency communication (URLLC), and massive machine-type communication (mMTC).
Understand the architecture of 5G New Radio (NR), including its key features and functionalities.
Explore the challenges and opportunities of millimeter wave communication, including channel modeling and beamforming techniques.
